comments.body: Please let Annie Rana from the Getty know when this is fixed.

Possible options discussed:

1. A link on the front page.
2. A link at the top of the table contents in https://cicognara.org/catalogo
3. Some text at the top of https://cicognara.org/catalogo that says something like "You might be interested in the Vatican's Annotated Catalogo Copy: link"

Any or all of these might be a button.

Maybe related: there are a couple of other versions of the catalogo we could link to:
* PDF volumes in github (these could be loaded into Figgy): https://github.com/pulibrary/cicognara-catalogo/tree/master/memofonte_edition
* Our TEI derived from those PDFs: https://github.com/pulibrary/cicognara-catalogo/blob/master/catalogo.tei.xml
Heidelberg also has a scan online, which I think also has OCR

Based on discussion with Gabriel Swift, it would be better to import metadata from PULFA for the WA photographs than continue to use the forked MODS records. These records should be ingested with the PULFA component ID to use imported metadata.
METS files are in the Plum/Figgy/DPUL team drive: https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/1BQNa-sKpNTj0Ys3jcNT188ovz_4W834O

Based on discussion with Gabriel Swift, it would be better to import metadata from PULFA for the WA photographs than continue to use the forked MODS records. These records should be updated with the PULFA component ID to use imported metadata.

As noted above, the METS/MODS data does not reference the finding aid, so we should get the ARK-to-component-id mapping from the EAD, and use the ARK to find the matching records:
```
db.query_service.custom_queries.find_by_property(property: :identifier, value: "ark:/88435/3197xm27p")
```

Based on discussion with Gabriel Swift, it would be better to import metadata from PULFA for the WA photographs than continue to use the forked MODS records. These records should be ingested with the PULFA component ID to use imported metadata.
METS files are in the Plum/Figgy/DPUL team drive: https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/16WeKDIkLWQM5YjK6Jn0W22I5XeULEvLq

comments.body: Do you need my input/information gathering on this, @tpendragon and @hackmastera?

@kelea99 We're working on some documentation of architectural decisions that were made in the past as a way of externalizing institutional memory. So I don't think we'll need you but I'm happy to @ you on the PR if you'd like to review what we produce. To give you a sense of what these will look like, here are some we did yesterday: https://github.com/pulibrary/pomegranate/pull/722/files

princeton_ansible.title: svn server playbook should install an svn hook and an XML schema

comments.body:
http://lib-svn-staging1.princeton.edu ?


Get Outlook for Android<https://aka.ms/ghei36>
________________________________
From: Cliff Wulfman <notifications@github.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 30, 2020 11:32:36 AM
To: pulibrary/princeton_ansible <princeton_ansible@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Regine I. Heberlein <heberlei@Princeton.EDU>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>
Subject: [pulibrary/princeton_ansible] svn server playbook should install an svn hook and an XML schema (#1254)


On the old server, @sdellis<https://github.com/sdellis> and @regineheberlein<https://github.com/regineheberlein> had implemented a pre-commit hook to catch mal-formed XML documents. The hook entails validating a document against the Library of Congress's EAD schema using the xmllint utility.

The schema should be be stored in /usr/local/share/xml/schema.

The code for the hook can be found on the old server (where?).

@kayiwa<https://github.com/kayiwa> asked that the various components be installed manually on "staging" (which staging machine) to test, and then that he be provided with instructions for modifying the Ansible playbook.

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/issues/1254?email_source=notifications&email_token=ABNKKU7E2RBGG3OVBAKDCFDRAL6KJA5CNFSM4KNZCD22YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFUVEXG43VMWVGG33NNVSW45C7NFSM4IJ4PCRA>, or unsubscribe<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABNKKUYIDFYS5XSC22G26XLRAL6KJANCNFSM4KNZCD2Q>.

The official EAD schema is here: `https://www.loc.gov/ead/ead.xsd`.

Here's the hook code to be installed as `/svn/pulfa/hooks/pre-commit`:

```sh
#!/bin/bash

REPOS="$1"
TXN="$2"
AWK=/usr/bin/awk
XMLLINT=/usr/bin/xmllint
EADSCHEMA='/usr/local/share/xml/schema/ead.xsd'

# Make sure that the log message contains some text.
SVNLOOK=/usr/bin/svnlook
$SVNLOOK log -t "$TXN" "$REPOS" | \
   grep "[a-zA-Z0-9]" > /dev/null || exit 1

# Exit on all errors.
set -e

for FILE in $($SVNLOOK changed $REPOS -t $TXN | $AWK -F '   ' '{IGNORECASE = 1; if (($1 ~ /^A|U/) && ($2 ~ /\.(EAD.xml)$/)) print $2};')
do
    $XMLLINT -schema $EADSCHEMA <($SVNLOOK cat -t $TXN $REPOS $FILE)
done

# All checks passed, so allow the commit.
exit 0
```
thanks @cwulfman

princeton_ansible.title: curators blog is not showing up

comments.body:
``` pulcerts % http http://libblogs.princeton.edu HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found Connection: keep-alive Content-Length: 153 Content-Type: text/html Date: Thu, 30 Jan 2020 20:04:59 GMT Server: nginx/1.17.6 404 Not Found

404 Not Found

nginx/1.17.6
```

oh... interesting. ``` pulcerts % http libblogs.princeton.edu/renovations HTTP/1.1 301 Moved Permanently Connection: keep-alive Content-Length: 169 Content-Type: text/html Date: Thu, 30 Jan 2020 20:11:06 GMT Location: https://library.princeton.edu/firestone/renovations/ Server: nginx/1.17.6 301 Moved Permanently

301 Moved Permanently

nginx/1.17.6
pulcerts % http libblogs.princeton.edu/republic HTTP/1.1 301 Moved Permanently Connection: keep-alive Content-Length: 169 Content-Type: text/html Date: Thu, 30 Jan 2020 20:11:35 GMT Location: https://library.princeton.edu/republic/ Server: nginx/1.17.6 301 Moved Permanently

301 Moved Permanently

nginx/1.17.6
``` it seems like there's folks (robots) who know about `libblogs.princeton.edu` and keep hitting it.

pulfalight.title: Users should be able to submit corrections for content in a collection or component
Users should be able to submit questions concerning a collection or component
Upgrades rubyzip, devise, and bootstrap, along with the serialize-javascript JavaScript package
Ensure that content negotiation exposes XML encoded finding aids
Ensure that content is indexed in Google (and other major search engines) for discovery
Ensure that PULFALight is WCAG 2.0 AA accessible
Provide a list of linked authoritative names for finding aids (name authority/identity management)
Ensure that mobile devices (smartphones and tablets) are able to view and interact with PULFALight
Date searching should warn users of the presence of undated material
Every Finding Aid should have a single page view
